conclusion: To find the average velocity and average speed of the particle.
The displacement x is the straight-line distance from point A to point C.
The total horizontal displacement is x = 2R = 2 x 1 m = 2 m.
Average velocity is the displacement divided by the time taken.
Average velocity = x/t = 2 m/5 s = 0.4 m/s.
The distance s is the total path length of the two semicircles.
The circumference of a full circle with radius 1 m is 2π m.
The length of one semicircle is π m.
The total distance for two semicircles is s = 2 x π x 1 m = 2π m.
Average speed is the total distance traveled divided by the time taken.
Average speed = s/t = 2π m/5 s ≈ 1.26 m/s.
Final Answer: Average velocity: 0.4 m/s, Average speed: 1.26 m/s.
